records.name: A Fate Worse Than Death
records.text: Action: During a conflict, choose a participating character – bow that character, move it home, dishonor it, and remove 1 fate from it. Until the end of the phase, treat its printed text box as if it were blank (except for Traits).

records.name: A Legion of One
records.text: Action: During a [conflict-military] conflict, choose a character that is participating on your side alone – until the end of the conflict, that character gets +3[conflict-military]. You may remove 1 fate from that character to resolve this ability twice.

records.name: Abandoning Honor
records.text: This province gets +2 strength while you have a Fire role. Interrupt: When this province is broken, choose a dishonored character – discard that character.

records.name: Above Question
records.text: Attached character cannot be chosen as a target of an opponent's event.

pack_cards.flavor: "Excuse me, samurai-san, but you must be mistaken! It could not possibly have been her."

records.name: Adept of Shadows
records.text: Action: Lose 1 honor – return this character to your hand.

pack_cards.flavor: There are dozens of ways to hide, and only one way to be seen.

records.name: Adept of the Waves
records.text: Action: Choose a character – until the end of the phase, that character gains covert during [element-water] conflicts.

pack_cards.flavor: "Water is flexible and yielding, yet none can withstand the crashing waves."

records.name: Admit Defeat
records.text: Action: Choose a character that is defending alone – bow that character.

pack_cards.flavor: It is not only a question of defeating one's opponents, but defeating them in such a manner that they know they have been beaten.

records.name: Adopted Kin
records.text: Fire role only. Limit 1 per character. Each other attachment on attached character gains ancestral.

pack_cards.flavor: Facing a crisis of children, the Dragon were willing to turn even to the peasantry to find new heirs.

records.name: Against the Waves
records.text: Action: Choose a Shugenja character – bow or ready that character.

pack_cards.flavor: Water is ever changing. A gentle wave one moment and a torrent of force the next.

records.name: Agasha Shunsen
records.text: Action: During a conflict, return 1 or more rings you have claimed to the unclaimed ring pool. Choose a character you control – search your conflict deck for an attachment with printed cost equal to or lower than the number of rings returned and attach it to that character. Shuffle.

records.name: Agasha Sumiko
records.text: While you have the Imperial Favor, this character does not bow as a result of conflict resolution while attacking.

pack_cards.flavor: "I will not merely record history. I will forge it myself."

records.name: Agasha Swordsmith
records.text: Action: Search the top 5 cards of your conflict deck for an attachment, reveal it, and add it to your hand. Shuffle.

records.name: Ageless Crone
records.text: During a conflict in which this character is participating, increase the cost for each player to play each event by 1.

pack_cards.flavor: "It is good to see you again, Grandmother. You have not aged a day. Ever." – Ikoma Ikehata

records.name: Aggressive Moto
records.text: This character cannot be declared as a defender.

pack_cards.flavor: Moto can die but cannot yield.

records.name: Akodo Gunsō
records.text: Pride. (After this character wins a conflict, honor it. After this character loses a conflict, dishonor it.) Reaction: After this character enters play from a province – refill that province faceup.

records.name: Akodo Kage
records.text: Reaction: After honor dials are revealed for an honor bid, if your bid is lower than an opponent's and you are more honorable thatn that opponent – set that opponent's honor dial to be equal to yours.

pack_cards.flavor: "Thank you, sensei. Your wisdom has again guided me to the right path." - Akodo Toturi

records.name: Akodo Toshiro
records.text: Action: While this character is attacking – it gets +5[conflict-military] until the end of the conflict. Provinces cannot be broken during this conflict. At the end of the conflict, if you do not control a Commander character, discard this character.

pack_cards.flavor: "You are the most gifted swordsman of your generation. Why must you waste your time on this cowardly art?" Akodo Gendo

records.name: Akodo Toturi
records.text: Reaction: After you claim a ring during a [conflict-military] conflict in which this character is participating – resolve that ring's effect.

pack_cards.flavor: A lion is more than his roar, his mane, his teeth, his heart. A lion is all of these.

records.name: All and Nothing
records.text: Interrupt: When you would resolve the [element-void] ring effect, choose another ring – resolve that ring's effect instead. Draw 1 card.

records.name: Along the River of Gold
records.text: Water role only. Action: During a conflict at a [element-water] province, choose a participating character – switch that character's base [conflict-military] and [conflict-political] skill until the end of the conflict.

records.name: Ambush
records.text: Action: During a conflict, choose up to 2 [clan-scorpion] characters with total printed cost 6 or lower from your hand and/or provinces – put those characters into play as participating characters.

records.name: Ancestral Armory
records.text: Action: Sacrifice this holding, choose a Weapon attachment in your discard pile – return that attachment to your hand.

pack_cards.flavor: "This is the spear of Matsu Okimoto. Do not dishonor his memory."

records.name: Ancestral Daishō
records.text: Ancestral. (When attached card leaves play, return this card to your hand.) Restricted. (No more than two restricted attachments per character.)

records.name: Ancestral Lands
records.text: This province gets +5 strength during [conflict-political] conflicts.

pack_cards.flavor: "Our claim on these lands stretches back to the dawn of the Empire."

records.name: Ancient Master
records.text: You may play this character as an attachment with the text: "Reaction: After attached character is declared as an attacker or defender – search the top 5 cards of your conflict deck for a Kihō or Tattoo card, reveal it, and add it to your hand. Shuffle.

records.name: Appealing to the Fortunes
records.text: This province gets +2 strength while you have a Void role. Interrupt: When this province is broken – put a character into play from one of your provinces or from your hand.

records.name: Apprentice Earthcaller
records.text: Action: During a conflict, choose an attacking character without attachments – until the end of the conflict, set that character's skill values to its printed values.

pack_cards.flavor: "The kami are already angry. It's not difficult to turn their rage to your advantage." – Kuni Yori

records.name: Artisan Academy
records.text: Action: During the conflict phase – reveal the top card of your conflict deck. Until the end of the phase, you may play that card as if it were in your hand.

records.name: Asahina Artisan
records.text: Action: During a conflict, bow this character. Choose another [clan-crane] character – that character gets +3[conflict-political] until the end of the conflict.

records.name: Asahina Storyteller
records.text: Sincerity. (When this character leaves play, draw 1 card.) Each honored [clan-crane] character you control gains sincerity.

records.name: Asahina Takako
records.text: You may look at facedown cards in each province you control. Action: Choose a card in one of your provinces – switch that card with a card in another of your provinces or discard it.

pack_cards.flavor: "Life is already fleeting. Why waste such precious time with war?"

records.name: Asako Azunami
records.text: Interrupt: When you would resolve the [element-water] ring – instead of the normal ring effect, you may choose and bow any character and you may choose and ready a different character.

records.name: Asako Diplomat
records.text: Reaction: After this character wins a conflict, choose a character – honor or dishonor that character.

records.name: Asako Tsuki
records.text: Reaction: After the [element-water] ring is claimed, choose a Scholar character – honor that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "History is fixed, but the future flows."

records.name: Ascetic Visionary
records.text: No attachments except Monk or Tattoo. Action: While this character is attacking, spend 1 fate to an unclaimed ring. Choose a Monk character or a character with a Monk attachment – ready that character.

records.name: Assassination
records.text: Action: During a conflict, lose 3 honor. Choose a character with printed cost 2 or lower – discard that character. (Max 1 per round.)

records.name: Awakened Tsukumogami
records.text: Void role only. You may use the fate on a ring to pay the cost of a conflict card that has a Trait that matches an element of that ring.

records.name: Back-Alley Hideaway
records.text: Interrupt: When a [clan-scorpion] character you control leaves play – attach that character to this holding facedown instead of placing it in its owner's discard pile. Action: Play an attached facedown character from this holding as if it were in this province. Then, sacrifice this holding.

records.name: Backhanded Compliment
records.text: Keeper role only. Action: Choose a player – that player draws 1 card and loses 1 honor.

pack_cards.flavor: "No one could accuse you of vanity with such a style."

records.name: Banzai!
records.text: Action: During a conflict, choose a participating character – that character gets +2[conflict-military] until the end of the conflict. You may lose 1 honor to resolve this ability twice. (Max 1 per conflict.)

records.name: Battle Maiden Recruit
records.text: This character gets +2[conflict-military] while you have claimed the [element-water] or [element-void] ring.

records.name: Bayushi Aramoro
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a [conflict-military] conflict, dishonor this character and choose a participating character controlled by your opponent – until the end of the conflict, that character gets -2[conflict-military] and is discarded if its [conflict-military] skill is 0.

pack_cards.flavor: "This is for you, Kachiko"

records.name: Bayushi Kachiko
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a [conflict-political] conflict, choose a participating character with lower [conflict-political] than this character – move the chosen character home. Then, you may bow it.

pack_cards.flavor: "Which of us would bid this game to end? We are nearly perfectly matched, but there can be only one victor."

records.name: Bayushi Liar
records.text: Sincerity. (When this character leaves play, draw 1 card.)

pack_cards.flavor: "I sincerely doubt that asking you to trust me will change your mind, and yet, I ask anyway."

records.name: Bayushi Manipulator
records.text: Reaction: After honor dials are revealed – increase the value of your bid by 1.

pack_cards.flavor: "Victory does not always go to the strongest of two opponents." - Bayushi's Lies

records.name: Bayushi Shoju
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a [conflict-political] conflict, choose a participating character controlled by your opponent – until the end of the conflict, that character gets –1[conflict-political] and is discarded if its [conflict-political] skill is 0. (Limit twice per round.)

pack_cards.flavor: "Believing what is true is only sensible."
pack_cards.illustrator: Shawn Ignatius Tan and Le Vuong

records.name: Bayushi Yojiro
records.text: While this character is participating in a conflict, ignore the effects of each status token on each participating character.

pack_cards.flavor: "If you will not believe a word I say, I may as well tell the truth."

records.name: Bayushi Yunako
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, choose a character – switch that character's base [conflict-military] and [conflict-political] skill until the end of the conflict.

records.name: Beastmaster Matriarch
records.text: This character has +2[conflict-military] for each ring in each opponent's claimed ring pool.

pack_cards.flavor: "I have always heard that the Lion’s greatest weapon is their pride." – Ikoma Ikehata

records.name: Before the Throne
records.text: Cannot be the stronghold province. Interrupt: When this province is broken – take 2 honor from your opponent.

pack_cards.flavor: "Your August Imperial Majesty, your humble servant comes before you..."

records.name: Being and Becoming
records.text: Void role only. Attach to a character you control. Action: Bow attached character, choose an unclaimed ring – move each fate from that ring to attached character.

records.name: Benten's Touch
records.text: Action: During a conflict, bow a (friendly) [clan-phoenix] Shugenja character. Choose a participating character you control – honor that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "Blessed Benten, Lady of Love and Beauty, shine your radiance upon me. Let my hands work your beauty in the mortal realm and my words spread your grace to all."

records.name: Blackmail Artist
records.text: Reaction: After this character wins a [conflict-political] conflict – take 1 honor from your opponent.

pack_cards.flavor: "The real art lies in convincing your mark that you are bound, by duty and honor, to expose him. At which point, buying you off becomes his idea."

records.name: Blackmail
records.text: Play only if you are less honorable than your opponent. Action: During a conflict, choose a character with printed cost 2 or lower controlled by your opponent – take control of that character until the end of the conflict.

records.name: Blood of Onnotangu
records.text: Seeker role only. During conflicts at this province, each player cannot spend fate from his or her fate pool.

records.name: Bonsai Garden
records.text: Action: During an [element-air] conflict – gain 1 honor.

pack_cards.flavor: "Daily caretaking leads to a life of peace." – Tao of Shinsei

records.name: Border Fortress
records.text: Action: During a conflict at this province, choose a facedown province – reveal that province.

pack_cards.flavor: The first stage of attack. The first line of defense.

records.name: Border Rider
records.text: Action: Ready this character.

pack_cards.flavor: Ride to the horizon and back again. Only then can you begin to comprehend the Unicorn.

records.name: Borderlands Defender
records.text: While this character is defending, opponents' card effects cannot bow it or move it.

pack_cards.flavor: Even when faced with such hardship, the Crab Clan has never wavered, standing steadfast in its duty to protect the southern border of the Empire.

records.name: Borderlands Fortifications
records.text: Action: Choose a card in one of your provinces – switch this holding with that card.

records.name: Born in War
records.text: Cavalry character only. X is equal to the number of unclaimed rings.

records.name: Brash Samurai
records.text: Action: While this character is your only participating character in a conflict – honor this character.

pack_cards.flavor: A samurai lives at all times three feet from death.

records.name: Breach of Etiquette
records.text: Action: During a [conflict-political] conflict – until the end of the conflict, each time a player triggers an ability on a non-Courtier character, he or she loses 1 honor (Max 1 per conflict.)

records.name: Breakthrough
records.text: Reaction: After the resolution of your first conflict this phase as the attacking player, if that conflict broke a province – immediately declare your second conflict for this phase.

records.name: Bustling Academy
records.text: Action: If you control a Scholar character – discard a card in a province and refill it faceup.

records.name: Calling in Favors
records.text: Action: Dishonor a (friendly) character. Choose an opponent's attachment – take control of that attachment and attach it to that character, if able. Otherwise, discard the attachment.

records.name: Callow Delegate
records.text: Interrupt: When this character leaves play, choose a character you control – honor that character.

records.name: Captive Audience
records.text: Action: During a [conflict-political] conflict, lose 1 honor – change the conflict type to [conflict-military].

pack_cards.flavor: "Now you must heed our demands!"

records.name: Cautious Scout
records.text: While this character is attacking alone, treat the defending province as if its printed text box were blank (except for Traits).

pack_cards.flavor: They told him to be careful, but there was only one way to know for sure.

records.name: Cavalry Reserves
records.text: Action: During a [conflict-military] conflict, choose up to 6 printed cost worth of Cavalry characters in your dynasty discard pile – put those characters into play in the conflict.

records.name: Censure
records.text: Play only if you have the Imperial Favor. Interrupt: When the effects of an event would initiate – cancel those effects.

pack_cards.flavor: "I bring word from the Imperial Chancellor."

records.name: Centipede Tattoo
records.text: Monk character only. Attached character gains the Tattooed trait. Attached character does not bow as a result of conflict resolution in conflicts in which it lost.

records.name: Charge!
records.text: Action: During a [conflict-military] conflict, choose a character in one of your provinces – put that character into play in the conflict.

pack_cards.flavor: A samurai must always be ready. Ready to fight. And ready, if need be, to die.

records.name: Chasing the Sun
records.text: Seeker role only. Action: During a conflict in which you are the attacking player – move the contested ring to another eligible province and reveal it, if able. That province is now the attacked province.

records.name: Chikai Order Protector
records.text: While this character is defending, if you control a participating Courtier or Shugenja character, this character does not bow as a result of conflict resolution.

pack_cards.flavor: "I need not understand the Elemental Masters' wisdom, so long as it remains safe with them."

records.name: Child of the Plains
records.text: Reaction: After a province this character is attacking is revealed – the attacker has the first action opportunity this conflict.

records.name: Chisei District
records.text:
Limit 1 per deck.
[conflict-military] conflicts cannot be declared against this holding's province.

records.name: City of Lies
records.text: Action: Reduce the cost of the next event you play this phase by 1.

pack_cards.flavor: In Ryokō Owari Toshi, koku could pave any road.

records.name: City of the Open Hand
records.text: Action: If you are less honorable than an opponent, bow this stronghold – take 1 honor from that player.

records.name: Clarity of Purpose
records.text: Action: During a conflict, choose a character you control – until the end of that conflict, opponents' card effects cannot bow that character and it does not bow as a result of conflict resolution during [conflict-political] conflicts.

records.name: Cloud the Mind
records.text: Play only if you control a Shugenja character. Treat attached character as if its printed text box were blank (except for Traits).

records.name: Consumed by Five Fires
records.text: Seeker role only. Action: If you control a Shugenja character – remove up to 5 fate from among characters an opponent controls.

pack_cards.flavor: "By these fires be cleansed." – Isawa Masahiro

records.name: Contingency Plan
records.text: Reaction: After honor dials are revealed – increase or decrease the value of your bid by 1 (to a minimum of 0).

pack_cards.flavor: "The only thing that is certain is that something will go wrong." - Bayushi's Lies

records.name: Court Games
records.text: Action: During a [conflict-political] conflict, select one – choose and honor a participating character you control, or your opponent chooses and dishonors a participating character he or she controls. (Max 1 per conflict.)

records.name: Court Mask
records.text: Attach to a character you control. Action: Return this attachment to your hand and dishonor attached character.

records.name: Court Novice
records.text: This character gets +2[conflict-political] while you have claimed the [element-air] or [element-water] ring.

pack_cards.flavor: "Each detail you reveal is another tool your opponent will use against you." – Sensei Nagori

records.name: Court of Deception
records.text: Action: If you have 6 or fewer honor, choose a dishonored character in you home area – discard that character's status token.

pack_cards.flavor: Where the truth lies.

records.name: Crisis Breaker
records.text: Keeper role only. Action: During a [conflict-military] conflict, if your opponent counts more current [conflict-military] skill than you, choose a Berserker character you control – ready that character and move it to the conflict.

records.name: Cunning Magistrate
records.text: While this character is participating in a conflict, each other character that is dishonored does not count its skill toward the resolution of this conflict.

pack_cards.flavor: "Let them fear the law and be better for it."

records.name: Curry Favor
records.text: Reaction: After a character you control bows as a result of conflict resolution from the second conflict you declared this round – ready that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "How could the Crane do any less for our honored allies?"

records.name: Daidoji Nerishma
records.text: Action: Choose a facedown card in one of your provinces – turn that card faceup.

pack_cards.flavor: "It's an ambush! Be ready!"

records.name: Daimyō's Favor
records.text: Attach to a character you control. Action: Bow this attachment – reduce the cost of the next attachment you play on this character this phase by 1.

records.name: Deathseeker
records.text: Reaction: After this character loses a conflict as an attacker, sacrifice this character. Choose a character controlled by your opponent – if that character has no fate on it, discard it. Otherwise, remove 1 fate from that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "I shall redeem my name in service to my clan!"

records.name: Deceptive Offer
records.text: Action: During a conflict, choose a participating character you control. Your opponent selects one – that character gets +2[conflict-military] and +2[conflict-political] until the end of the conflict, or your opponent gives you 1 honor.

records.name: Defend the Wall
records.text: Reaction: After you win a conflict at this province – resolve the ring effect of that conflict as if you were the attacking player.

records.name: Demonstrating Excellence
records.text: This province gets +2 strength while you have an Air role. Interrupt: When this province is broken – gain 1 fate and draw 1 card.

records.name: Discourage Pursuit
records.text: Earth role only. Action: During a conflict, dishonor a (friendly) Shinobi character. Choose a participating character – until the end of the conflict, that character gets -4[conflict-military].

records.name: Disdainful Remark
records.text: Keeper role only. Action: During a conflict, if you control a participating Courtier character – until the end of the conflict, the attacked province gets +X strength. X is equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

records.name: Disguised Protector
records.text: Action: During a conflict in which this character is participating – each player adds the bid on his or her honor dial to his or her skill during this conflict's resolution.

pack_cards.flavor: Her face might be bare, but she was never without a mask.

records.name: Dispatch
records.text: Limited. (No more than one limited card can be played by each player each round.) Action: Move a [clan-unicorn] character you control into a conflict or home from a conflict.

records.name: Display of Power
records.text: Reaction: After you lose an unopposed conflict – cancel the ring effect of that conflict. Then, you resolve that ring effect as if you had won the conflict as the attacking player. Claim that ring.

records.name: Doji Challenger
records.text: Action: While this character is attacking, choose a character controlled by your opponent – move that character to this conflict.

pack_cards.flavor: "I hope you are prepared to defend your words with steel!"

records.name: Doji Gift Giver
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, give your opponent 1 fate. That opponent must choose a ready participating character he or she controls – bow that character.

records.name: Doji Hotaru
records.text: Reaction: After you claim a ring during a [conflict-political] conflict in which this character is participating – resolve that ring's effect.

pack_cards.flavor: "Were it not for the rule of kō, we would be trapped in this game for eternity. We are nearly perfectly matched."

records.name: Doji Representative
records.text: Action: During a conflict – move this character home.

pack_cards.flavor: "I regret that I must decline your gracious invitation."

records.name: Doji Shigeru
records.text: Reaction: After your opponent plays an event during a conflict in which this character is participating – that opponent chooses and discards a card from his or her hand. (Unlimited.)

pack_cards.flavor: It is humbling to be mistaken for the beautiful Lady Shike.

records.name: Doji Shizue
records.text: During the fate phase, if you have the Imperial Favor, this character cannot lose fate or be discarded.

pack_cards.flavor: "Mukashi mukashi..."
"Lean closer, that I might tell you something only the willows should hear..."

records.name: Doomed Shugenja
records.text: Limited. (No more than one limited card can be played by each player each round.) You cannot place fate on this character when it is played from one of your provinces.

records.name: Duelist Training
records.text: Attached character gains: "Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, choose a participating character controlled by your opponent – challenge that character to a [conflict-military] duel. Instead of giving honor for this duel's bid, a player may choose and discard the required number of cards from hand. Bow the loser of the duel."

records.name: Duty
records.text: Limit 1 per deck. Interrupt: When the effect of a card ability, ring effect, or framework step would cause you to lose your last honor – cancel that effect, then gain 1 honor.

pack_cards.flavor: "I will be your villain, Hantei." - Bayushi
The first to fight, the first to die.

records.name: Elemental Fury
records.text: Reaction: After this province is revealed – switch the contested ring with an unclaimed ring. (The conflict retains its type.)

records.name: Embrace the Void
records.text: Play only if you control a Shugenja character. Interrupt: When 1 or more fate would be removed from attached character – instead, move that fate to your fate pool.

records.name: Endless Plains
records.text: Reaction: After an attack is declared here, break this province. Your opponent chooses an attacking character – discard that character.

records.name: Enigmatic Magistrate
records.text: While this character is attacking, only characters that have an odd printed cost count their skill toward the resolution of this conflict.

pack_cards.flavor: "Is it just to uphold an unjust law?"

records.name: Enlightened Warrior
records.text: Reaction: After an opponent selects a ring with fate on it – place 1 fate on this character.

pack_cards.flavor:
In heart, air.
In spirit, earth.
In sword, fire.
In body, water.
In mind, void.

records.name: Entrenched Position
records.text: This province gets +5 strength during [conflict-military] conflicts.

pack_cards.flavor: "It would take an entire Moto horde to break through here."

records.name: Ethereal Dreamer
records.text: Reaction: After the conflict phase begins, choose a ring – until the end of this phase, this character gets +2[conflict-military] and +2[conflict-political] while that ring is being contested.

records.name: Even the Odds
records.text: Action: During a conflict, if you control fewer participating characters than your opponent, choose a character you control – move that character to the conflict. If that character is a Commander, honor it.

records.name: Fair Accord
records.text: Action: During the dynasty phase, discard the Imperial Favor – gain 2 fate.

pack_cards.flavor: "So long as there is the light of 'I want to make a deal,' even the most painful negotiations will eventually pay off." – Yasuki Taka, the Wily Trader

records.name: Fallen in Battle
records.text: Reaction: After you win a [conflict-military] conflict by 5 or more skill, choose a participating character – discard that character. (Max 1 per conflict.)

records.name: Favor of the Kami
records.text: Attached character gets +1 glory.

pack_cards.flavor:
"Like air, invisible.
Like water, formless.
Like earth, unchanging.
Like fire, powerful."
- Isawa's Elements

records.name: Favorable Ground
records.text: Action: During a conflict, sacrifice this holding. Choose a character you control – move that character to the conflict or home from the conflict.

records.name: Favored Mount
records.text: Attach to a character you control. Attached character gains Cavalry. Action: During a conflict, bow this attachment – move attached character to the conflict.

records.name: Favored Niece
records.text: Action: Choose and discard 1 card from your hand – draw 1 card. (Limit twice per round.)

pack_cards.flavor: Not once in her life had she needed to ask twice.

records.name: Fawning Diplomat
records.text: Interrupt: When this character leaves play – claim the Imperial Favor.

pack_cards.flavor: Flattery is the currency of the court.

records.name: Fearsome Mystic
records.text: This character gets +2 glory during [element-air] conflicts. Action: While this character is participating in a conflict – remove 1 fate from each participating character your opponent controls with lower glory than this character.

records.name: Feast or Famine
records.text: Fire role only. Interrupt: When this province is broken, choose an opponent's character – move each fate from that character to a character you control with no fate.

pack_cards.flavor: One man’s famine is another man’s feast.

records.name: Feral Ningyo
records.text: Action: During a [element-water] conflict – put this character into play from your hand in the conflict. At the end of the conflict, shuffle it into your conflict deck.

pack_cards.flavor: The sea's embrace is cold and sharp.

records.name: Fertile Fields
records.text: Action: During a conflict at this province – draw 1 card.

pack_cards.flavor: "Inari-no-Kami smiles upon these lands." - Aiko, priestess of Inari
They had considered every possible vulnerability, save one.

records.name: Fight On
records.text: Water role only. Action: While you are the defending player, choose a bowed character you control – ready that character and move it to the conflict.

pack_cards.flavor: "If wse rest, the entire Empire falls."

records.name: Fine Katana
records.text: Restricted. (No more than two restricted attachments per character.)

pack_cards.flavor:
Immortal steel waits
Venerated divine blade
The fires of the soul

records.name: Finger of Jade
records.text: Attach to a character you control. Interrupt: When the effects of a card ability that targets attached character would initiate, sacrifice this attachment – cancel those effects.

records.name: Fire Elemental Guard
records.text: No attachments except Spell. Action: During a conflict in which you have played 3 or more Spell cards, choose an attachment – discard that attachment.

pack_cards.flavor: "Can you coax your mind from wandering and keep to the original oneness?" - Tao of Shinsei

records.name: Flooded Waste
records.text: Reaction: After this province is revealed – bow each attacking character.

pack_cards.flavor: Where none survive to cremate the fallen, rot and corruption reign.

records.name: For Greater Glory
records.text: Reaction: After you break a province during a [conflict-military] conflict – place 1 fate on each participating Bushi character you control. (Max 1 per conflict.)

pack_cards.flavor: "Our names shall never be forgotten!"

records.name: For Shame!
records.text: Action: During a conflict, if you control a participating Courtier character, choose a participating character controlled by your opponent. Your opponent must select one – dishonor the chosen character or bow it.

records.name: Force of the River
records.text: Attach to a Shugenja character you control. Action: During a conflict – put each facedown card in your provinces into play facedown in the conflict as 1[conflict-military], -[conflict-political], 0 glory characters with the Cavalry and Spirit traits. Discard those characters at the end of the conflict.

records.name: Forged Edict
records.text: Interrupt: When the effects of an event would initiate, dishonor a (friendly) Courtier character – cancel those effects.

records.name: Forgotten Library
records.text: Reaction: After the draw phase begins – draw 1 card.

pack_cards.flavor: Truth cannot be lost, only forgotten.

records.name: Formal Invitation
records.text: Attach to a character with glory 2 or higher. Action: During a [conflict-political] conflict – move attached character to the conflict.

pack_cards.flavor: "It would be an honor if you would join us."

records.name: Frostbitten Crossing
records.text: Air role only. Action: During a conflict at this province, choose a participating character – discard each attachment on that character.

records.name: Fū Sui Disciple
records.text: Action: The player that has the [element-air] ring in his or her claimed ring pool chooses an ordinary character he or she controls. You select one – honor or dishonor that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "The energies of Sun and Moon, of the Five Elements — all must be balanced."

records.name: Funeral Pyre
records.text: Action: Sacrifice a (friendly) character – draw 1 card.

pack_cards.flavor: "We speed our fallen to Meido, that they do not rise again."

records.name: Fushichō
records.text: No attachments. Interrupt: When this character leaves play, choose a [clan-phoenix] character in your dynasty pile – put that character into play with 1 fate on it.

records.name: Gaijin Customs
records.text: Action: If you control a [clan-unicorn] card, choose a non-[clan-unicorn] character – ready the chosen character.

pack_cards.flavor: They stood, unmoving, each unsure how to proceed.

records.name: Game of Sadane
records.text: Action: During a conflict, choose a participating character you control and a participating character your opponent controls – your character challenges the opponent's character to a [conflict-political] duel. Honor the duel's winner and dishonor the duel's loser.

records.name: Gifted Tactician
records.text: Reaction: After this character wins a [conflict-military] conflict – draw 1 card.

pack_cards.flavor: "If you are fighting only the present battle, you have already lost the war." - Kitsu Motso

records.name: Giver of Gifts
records.text: Action: Choose an attachment you control – move that attachment to an eligible character you control.

records.name: Goblin Sneak
records.text: Reaction: After this character enters play – place 1 fate from an opponent's fate pool on it.

pack_cards.flavor: "Goblins? Impossible. Goblins have never been spotted this far from the Wall."

records.name: Golden Plains Outpost
records.text: Action: During a [conflict-military] conflict, bow this stronghold. Choose a Cavalry character you control – move it to that conflict.

records.name: Good Omen
records.text: Play only if your honor bid is lower than an opponent's. Action: Choose a character with printed cost 3 or higher – place 1 fate on that character.

records.name: Grasp of Earth
records.text: Attach to a Shugenja character you control. Action: During a conflict, bow this attachment – opponents' characters cannot move to this conflict or be played from hand until the end of the conflict.

records.name: Guard Duty
records.text: Keeper role only. Action: If attached character is defending – honor it.

pack_cards.flavor:
"But mother," said the young Lion, "how am I to find glory if I remain behind?"
"You will find honor," said his mother. "And a Lion requires nothing more." – Ikoma's Chronicles

records.name: Guardian Kami
records.text: Keeper role only. Action: While this character is defending, sacrifice it – resolve the ring effect of the contested ring as if you won the conflict as the attacking player. (Max 1 per conflict.)

records.name: Guardians of the Seikitsu
records.text: Earth role only. Reaction: After this province is revealed – bow each character with printed cost 2 or lower.

records.name: Guest of Honor
records.text: While this character is participating in a conflict, opponents cannot play events.

pack_cards.flavor: "You wouldn't want to disgrace yourself in front of our distinguished guest, would you?"

records.name: Guidance of the Ancestors
records.text: Action: Play this attachment from your conflict discard pile.

pack_cards.flavor: "Oh blessed ancestors, hear my prayer! May the strength of your honor guide my steps and lead me to righteousness!"

records.name: Harmonize
records.text: Keeper role only. Action: During a conflict in which you are the defending player, choose a defending character and an attacking character with equal or lower printed cost – move each chosen character home.

records.name: Haughty Magistrate
records.text: While this character is attacking, characters with lower glory than this character do not count their skill toward the resolution of this conflict.

pack_cards.flavor: "There is the Tao and there is the Law. Both are the same under Heaven."

records.name: Hawk Tattoo
records.text: Attached character gains Tattooed. Reaction: After you play this attachment during a conflict – move attached character to the conflict. If attached character is a Monk, you may take another action after this one.

records.name: Heartless Intimidator
records.text: Reaction: After an opponent loses 1 or more honor – discard the top card of that player's conflict deck. (Unlimited.)

pack_cards.flavor: "A beautiful knife, isn't it?"

records.name: Height of Fashion
records.text: This attachment cannot be played during a conflict.

pack_cards.flavor: The tides of fashion ebb and flow. Stay ahead of them, or sink beneath the waves of obscurity.

records.name: Henshin Disciple
records.text:
While you have claimed or are contesting:
- the [element-air] ring, this character gets +2[conflict-political].
- the [element-earth] ring, this character gets +2[conflict-military].
- the [element-fire] ring, this character gains pride.

records.name: Heroic Resolve
records.text: Action: If you have 2 or more rings in your claimed ring pool – ready attached character.

pack_cards.flavor: So long as he never lost his feet, he would never stop fighting.

records.name: Hida Amoro
records.text: Forced Reaction: After a player passes on declaring a conflict – that player must sacrifice a character he or she controls. (Unlimited.)

records.name: Hida Guardian
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, choose another participating character – until the end of the conflict, that character gets +2[conflict-military] and +2[conflict-political] for each holding you control.

records.name: Hida Kisada
records.text: While you have not lost a conflict this phase, cancel the effects of the first action ability your opponent triggers from a card during each conflict.

pack_cards.flavor: "What need have I of glory to defend this Wall?"

records.name: Hida Tomonatsu
records.text: Reaction: After this character wins a conflict as a defender, sacrifice it. Choose a non-unique attacking character – return that character to the top of its owner's deck.

records.name: Hidden Moon Dojo
records.text: Limit 1 per deck. You may play cards in adjacent provinces as if they were in your hand. Action: During a conflict – turn a card in an adjacent province faceup.

records.name: High Kick
records.text: Action: During a [conflict-military] conflict, bow a (friendly) participating Monk character. Choose a participating character controlled by your opponent – bow that character. It cannot trigger abilities during this conflict.

records.name: Hiruma Ambusher
records.text: Reaction: After this character enters play as a defender, choose a character – that character's abilities cannot be triggered during this conflict.

records.name: Hiruma Kogoe
records.text: Sincerity. Reaction: After the draw phase begins, if you have lower honor than an opponent – look at the top 3 cards of your conflict deck and put them back in any order.

pack_cards.flavor: "Assume anything we see is probably dangerous."

records.name: Hiruma Outpost
records.text: While this card is in an unbroken province, it gains: "Reaction: After an opponent declares a conflict against a province that does not have a holding in it – that opponent loses 1 honor."

records.name: Hiruma Skirmisher
records.text: Reaction: After you play this character – it gains covert until the end of the phase.

pack_cards.flavor: "My lord, I bring grave tidings from beyond the Wall."

records.name: Hiruma Yōjimbō
records.text: This character cannot be declared as an attacker.

pack_cards.flavor: Enemies learned quickly: it was never wise to give her reason to draw that awful blade.

records.name: Hisu Mori Toride
records.text: Reaction: After you win a [conflict-military] conflict with more participating characters than your opponent, bow this stronghold and sacrifice a (friendly) Cavalry character – you may declare an additional [conflict-military] conflict this phase.

records.name: Hisu Mori Toride
records.text: Reaction: After you win a [conflict-military] conflict by 5 or more skill, bow this stronghold and sacrifice a (friendly) Bushi character – you may declare an additional [conflict-military] conflict this phase.

records.name: Hito District
records.text:
Limit 1 per deck.
[conflict-political] conflicts cannot be declared against this holding's province.

records.name: Honored Blade
records.text: Restricted. (No more than two restricted attachments per character.) Reaction: After attached character wins a conflict – gain 1 honor.

records.name: Honored General
records.text: During a conflict in which this character is participating, each other participating [clan-lion] character you control gets +1[conflict-military]. Reaction: After this character enters play – honor it.

records.name: Hurricane Punch
records.text: Action: During a conflict, choose a participating Monk character – that character gets +2[conflict-military] until the end of the conflict. Draw 1 card.

pack_cards.flavor: "Strike with one thousand fists and you need deliver only a single blow."

records.name: I Am Ready
records.text: Action: Remove 1 fate from a (friendly) [clan-unicorn] character – ready that character.

records.name: I Can Swim
records.text: Action: During a conflict, if the bid on your honor dial is higher than an opponent's, choose a participating dishonored character controlled by that opponent – discard that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "But scorpion! Now we will both die!"

records.name: Icon of Favor
records.text: While you have the Imperial Favor, attached character gets +1 glory. Reaction: After you win a [element-fire] conflict, honor attached character.

records.name: Ide Messenger
records.text: Action: During a conflict, spend 1 fate. Choose a character you control – move that character to the conflict.

records.name: Ide Tadaji
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, choose a ready non-participating character with printed cost 2 or lower controller by each player – move each chosen character to the conflict.

pack_cards.flavor: "Without a worthy opponent, victory is meaningless."

records.name: Ide Trader
records.text: Reaction: After 1 or more characters move to a conflict in which this character is participating, select one – gain 1 fate or draw 1 card. (Limit once per conflict.)

records.name: Ikebana Artisan
records.text: Interrupt: When you would lose 1 honor for an unopposed conflict – lose 1 fate instead. (Unlimited.)

pack_cards.flavor: "The art is in the flowers chosen, not merely their position."

records.name: Ikoma Eiji
records.text: Reaction: After you lose a [conflict-political] conflict – put a Bushi character with printed cost 3 or lower into play from your dynasty discard pile or provinces.

records.name: Ikoma Ikehata
records.text: Covert. Reaction: After this character wins a [conflict-political] conflict, choose a character you control – honor that character. Draw 1 card.

pack_cards.flavor: "I like to think of myself as the 'mane' event."

records.name: Ikoma Prodigy
records.text: Reaction: After 1 or more fate is placed on this character – gain 1 honor.

pack_cards.flavor: She was destined to follow the path of her ancestors, the path of the true Go sage.

records.name: Ikoma Reservist
records.text: This character gets 2[conflict-military] while you have claimed the [element-fire] or [element-water] ring.

pack_cards.flavor: "Take arms! The Unicorn are at our door!"

records.name: Ikoma Tsanuri
records.text: Action: During a conflict in which this character is participating, if you control 3 or more participating Bushi characters - until the end of the conflict, each participating character you control gets +1 [conflict-military] and +1 [conflict-political].

records.name: Ikoma Ujiaki
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, discard the Imperial Favor – turn each facedown card in each of your provinces faceup. Then, put up to 2 characters from your provinces into play participating in this conflict.

pack_cards.flavor: "I remember."

records.name: Illustrious Plagiarist
records.text: Action: Choose the topmost event in an opponent's conflict discard pile – this character gains each of that event's action abilities until the end of the phase.

pack_cards.flavor: "All good artists borrow. I am a great artist."

records.name: Imperial Librarian
records.text: Fire role only. Each other character gets +1 glory.

records.name: Imperial Storehouse
records.text: Action: Sacrifice this holding – draw 1 card.

records.name: Implacable Magistrate
records.text: While this character is attacking, only this character and honored characters count their skill toward the resolution of this conflit.

pack_cards.flavor: "A failure before the law is a failure of honor."

records.name: Impulsive Novice
records.text: This characters gets +1[conflict-military] and +1[conflict-political] while you have claimed the [element-fire] or [element-void] ring.

pack_cards.flavor: "You clearly have not seen what I can do."

records.name: Indomitable Will
records.text: Reaction: After you win a conflict in which you control only a single participating character – that character does not bow as a result of the conflict's resolution.

records.name: Infiltrator
records.text: Play only if the bid on your honor dial is higher than an opponent's. Action: During a conflict, look at the top card of an opponent's conflict deck – either immediately play that card as if it were in your hand or discard it.

records.name: Inquisitive Ishika
records.text: During a conflict, each card that has a Trait that matches an element of the contested ring has its cost to play reduced by 1.

pack_cards.flavor: "There was something formless before the universe was born. Serene. Empty. Infinite." - from the scrolls of the Starry Heaven Sanctuary

records.name: Insult to Injury
records.text: Reaction: After a Duelist character you control wins a duel – dishonor the losing character.

pack_cards.flavor: "Surely, your blade must have been caught in its sheath for your draw to have been so slow."

records.name: Intimidating Hida
records.text: Reaction: After an opponent passes on declaring a conflict – that player loses 1 honor.

pack_cards.flavor: "Is that all you've got?"

records.name: Invocation of Ash
records.text: Action: Lose 1 honor. Choose a character you control – move this attachment to that character. Then, remove 1 fate from that character.

records.name: Iron Mine
records.text: Interrupt: When a character you control would leave play – sacrifice this holding instead.

records.name: Isawa Atsuko
records.text: Action: During a [element-void] conflict – until the end of the conflict, each participating character you control gets +1[conflict-military] and +1[conflict-political] and each participating character your opponent controls gets –1[conflict-military] and –1[conflict-political].

records.name: Isawa Kaede
records.text:
Immune to opponent's ring effects.
While this character is attacking, the contested ring gains the [element-void] element. If this character wins the conflict as an attacker, instead of choosing an element to resolve, resolve each of that ring's effects.

pack_cards.flavor: "All fates are one."

records.name: Isawa Masahiro
records.text: Action: During a [element-fire] conflict, bow this character. Choose a participating character with printed cost 2 or lower – discard that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "The kami are my allies. How can you hope to stand against me?"

records.name: Isawa Mori Seidō
records.text: Action: Bow this stronghold, choose a character – that character gets +2 glory until the end of the phase.

records.name: Isawa Tadaka
records.text: Each opponent cannot play copies of event cards that are in his or her conflict discard pile unless the [element-earth] ring is in that player's claimed ring pool.

pack_cards.flavor: As a mountain's roots run deep, I shall not be moved.

records.name: Isawa Uona
records.text: Reaction: After you play an Air card during a conflict, choose a non-unique participating character – bow that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "We cannot always see that which guides our way."

records.name: Ishiken Initiate
records.text: This character gets +1[conflict-military] and +1[conflict-political] for each claimed ring.

pack_cards.flavor: The void is nothing. The void is everything.

records.name: Itinerant Philosopher
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, discard the Imperial Favor. Choose an opponent's participating character with 1 or more attachments – bow that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "A student must learn every falsehood before they can learn the truth."

records.name: Iuchi Shahai
records.text: Covert. Reduce the cost by 1 to play each Meishōdō attachment on this character or a neutral character.

records.name: Iuchi Wayfinder
records.text: Reaction: After this character enters play – look at a facedown province.

pack_cards.flavor: Chase the sun. Discover the world.

records.name: Jade Masterpiece
records.text: Action: Bow this attachment. Choose an unclaimed ring – move 1 fate from the chosen ring to another unclaimed ring.

pack_cards.flavor:
"Beauty? Enlightenment? A tragic waste of jade?
What do you see?" - Kitsuku Yaruma

records.name: Jade Tetsubō
records.text: Attach to a character you control. Restricted. Action: While attached character is participating in a conflict, bow this attachment. Choose a participating character with lower [conflict-military] skill than attached character – return all fate on that character to its owner's fate pool.

records.name: Jurōjin's Curse
records.text: Void role only. Forced Interrupt: When the fate phase ends, if attached character is ready – resolve a second fate phase after this one. (Max 1 per round.)

records.name: Kabuki Hero
records.text: Action: Spend 1 fate – this character gets +X[conflict-military] until the end of the conflict. X is equal to its [conflict-political] skill.

pack_cards.flavor:
"As a tear of dew on a fallen leaf –
as the glimmer of moonlight on a still lake –
such is the impermanence of this life."
 – Asahina Ichikawa

records.name: Kaito Kosori
records.text: During each [element-air] conflict, if you control at least 1 participating character and if this character is in your home area and ready, it contributes its skill to your side. Errata from RRG v1.3

pack_cards.flavor: An arrow, once loosed, cannot be recalled.

records.name: Kaito Temple Protector
records.text: While this character is defending, opponent's card effects cannot move it. Action: While this character is defending, choose another participating character - until the end of the conflict, set this character's base [conflict-military] and [conflict-political] skill to the chosen character's current skill values.

records.name: Kaiu Envoy
records.text: Courtesy. (When this character leaves play, gain 1 fate.) Sincerity. (When this character leaves play, draw 1 card.)

records.name: Kaiu Inventor
records.text: Action: Choose a holding you control – you may trigger each of that holding's triggered abilities an additional time this round (or specified period). Errata from RRG v1.1

pack_cards.flavor: "It will work...eventually."

records.name: Kaiu Shuichi
records.text: Covert. (When this character attacks, choose one character without covert. That character cannot be declared as a defender.) Action: During a conflict in which this character is participating, if there is a holding in play – gain 1 fate.

records.name: Kakita Asami
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a [conflict-political] conflict, if you count more current [conflict-political] skill in the conflict than your opponent – take 1 honor from that opponent.

records.name: Kakita Blade
records.text: Restricted. Attached character gets +2[conflict-political] while it is involved in a duel. Reaction: After attached character wins a duel – gain 1 honor.

records.name: Kakita Kaezin
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, your opponent must choose a participating character he or she controls – challenge that character to a [conflict-military] duel. If this character wins, move each character not involved in the duel home. If it loses, send it home.

pack_cards.flavor:
"For the coward, there is no life.
For the hero, there is no death."

records.name: Kakita Yoshi
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, discard the Imperial Favor – draw 3 cards. Reduce the cost of each event you play during this conflict by 2.

pack_cards.flavor: "I will not forget."

records.name: Kamayari
records.text: Bushi character only. Restricted. Reaction: After a character triggers an ability during a conflict in which attached character is participating – bow that character.

records.name: Kami Unleashed
records.text: Seeker role only. Action: While this character is attacking, sacrifice it – resolve the ring effect of the contested ring as if you won the conflict as the attacking player. (Max 1 per conflict.)

records.name: Kanjo District
records.text: Limit 1 per deck. Action: During a conflict, discard the Imperial Favor. Choose a participating character – bow that character and move it home.

records.name: Karada District
records.text: Limit 1 per deck. Action: Give an opponent 1 fate. Choose an attachment on a character that player controls – take control of that attachment and attach it to an eligible character you control, if able. Otherwise, discard it.

records.name: Karmic Twist
records.text: Action: Choose a non-unique character with 1 or more fate on it – move each fate from that character to a non-unique character with no fate on it controlled by the same player.

pack_cards.flavor: "This is not my fate; it is ours."

records.name: Katana of Fire
records.text: Play only if you control a Shugenja character. Restricted. Attached character gets +1[conflict-military] for each Fire card you control. Attached character gets +2[conflict-military] while the [element-fire] ring is in your claimed ring pool.

records.name: Keeper Initiate
records.text: Keeper role only. Reaction: After you claim a ring that matches the element of your role – put this character into play from your dynasty discard pile or provinces. Then, put 1 fate on this character.

records.name: Keeper of Air
records.text: Increase your deckbuilding influence value by 3. Reaction: After you win an [element-air] conflict as the defending player – gain 1 fate.

records.name: Keeper of Earth
records.text: Increase your deckbuilding influence value by 3. Reaction: After you win an [element-earth] conflict as the defending player – gain 1 fate.

records.name: Keeper of Fire
records.text: Increase your deckbuilding influence value by 3. Reaction: After you win a [element-fire] conflict as the defending player – gain 1 fate.

records.name: Keeper of Void
records.text: Increase your deckbuilding influence value by 3. Reaction: After you win a [element-void] conflict as the defending player – gain 1 fate.

records.name: Keeper of Water
records.text: Increase your deckbuilding influence value by 3. Reaction: After you win a [element-water] conflict as the defending player – gain 1 fate.

records.name: Kitsu Spiritcaller
records.text: Action: During a conflict, bow this character. Choose a character in one of your discard piles – put that character into play in the conflict. If that character is still in play at the end of the conflict, return it to the bottom of its deck.

records.name: Kitsu Warrior
records.text:
For each [conflict-military] ring that is claimed, this character gets +2[conflict-military].
For each [conflict-political] ring that is claimed, this character gets +2[conflict-political].

records.name: Kitsuki Investigator
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a [conflict-political] conflict, spend 1 fate to an unclaimed ring – look at your opponent's hand. Choose 1 of those cards and discard it. (Max 1 per conflict.)

records.name: Kitsuki's Method
records.text: Ancestral. (When attached card leaves play, return this card to your hand.) Restricted. (No more than two restricted attachments per character.)

pack_cards.flavor: Every detail, no matter how small, carries its own implications of the truth.

records.name: Kitsuki Yaruma
records.text: Courtesy. No Poison attachments. Reaction: After this character enters play, choose an unbroken province – turn that province facedown.

pack_cards.flavor: "One cannot send the mountains to the Emperor, but one can send an artist."

records.name: Know the World
records.text: Action: Switch a ring in your claimed ring pool with an unclaimed ring and gain all fate on that ring. (Retain the ring's conflict type.)

records.name: Kudaka
records.text: Reaction: After you claim the [element-air] ring – gain 1 fate and draw 1 card. (Limit twice per round.)

pack_cards.flavor: "It's tradition, this, just askin' the kami for their aid."

records.name: Kuni Laboratory
records.text: Each character you control gets +1[conflict-military] and +1[conflict-political]. Forced Reaction: After the conflict phase begins – lose 1 honor.

records.name: Kuni Ritsuko
records.text: Reaction: After this character wins a conflict as a defender, choose an attacking character – remove 1 fate from that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "The kami of earth abhor corruption even more than we do. Their aid is ours for the asking."

records.name: Kuni Yori
records.text: During [element-earth] conflicts, each character you control gets +1[conflict-military] and +1[conflict-political]. Action: During a conflict, lose 1 honor. Choose a player – that player discards 1 card at random from his or her hand.

pack_cards.flavor: "I know our enemy."

records.name: Kuroi Mori
records.text: Action: During a conflict at this province, select one – switch the contested ring with an unclaimed ring (the conflict retains its type), or switch the conflict type (the conflict retains its element).

records.name: Kyūden Bayushi
records.text: Action: Bow this stronghold and choose a dishonored character you control – ready that character. If you have 6 or fewer honor, that character gets +1[conflict-military] and +1[conflict-political] until the end of the phase.

records.name: Kyūden Isawa
records.text: Action: During a conflict, bow this stronghold – play a Spell event from your conflict discard pile as if it were in your hand. Remove that event from the game.

records.name: Let Go
records.text: Action: Choose an attachment – discard it.

pack_cards.flavor: The material world is but a distraction.

records.name: Levy
records.text: Action: Choose an opponent, that player must select one – give you 1 fate or 1 honor.

pack_cards.flavor: "Every clan must aid in the defense of Rokugan."

records.name: Lion's Pride Brawler
records.text: Action: While this character is attacking, choose a character with equal or lower [conflict-military] skill than this character – bow that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "Let me put it another way."

records.name: Magistrate Station
records.text: Action: Choose an honored character – ready that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "We cannot be cruel, but taxes must be paid. The poor harvest has put everyone on edge."

records.name: Magnificent Kimono
records.text: Attached character gains pride. (After this character wins a conflict, honor it. After this character loses a conflict, dishonor it.)

records.name: Magnificent Lighthouse
records.text: Action: Look at the top 3 cards of an opponent's deck. Discard 1 of those cards, place another on top of that deck, and the other on the bottom of that deck.

records.name: Manicured Garden
records.text: Action: During a conflict at this province – gain 1 fate.

pack_cards.flavor: The perfect garden maintains all five elements in harmony.

records.name: Mantis Seafarer
records.text: Air role only. Reaction: After this character wins a conflict, lose 1 honor – gain 1 fate. (Unlimited.)

pack_cards.flavor: "Nothing compares with a fresh sea breeze."

records.name: Mantis Tenkinja
records.text: Water role only. Interrupt: When you play an event, lose 1 honor – reduce the cost of that event by 1.

pack_cards.flavor: "None exist in the whole of the Emerald Empire who are as talented as they." - Yoritomo

records.name: Mantra of Earth
records.text: Reaction: After an opponent declares an [element-earth] conflict, choose a Monk character or a character with a Monk attachment – until the end of the conflict, opponents’ card effects cannot target that character. Draw 1 card.

records.name: Mantra of Fire
records.text: Reaction: After an opponent declares a [element-fire] conflict, choose a Monk character or a character with a Monk attachment – place 1 fate on that character and draw 1 card.

records.name: Mantra of Water
records.text: Reaction: After your opponent declares a [element-water] conflict, choose a Monk character or a character with a Monk attachment – ready that character and draw 1 card.

records.name: Marauding Oni
records.text: This character cannot be honored or dishonored. Forced Reaction: After this character is declared as an attacked or defender – lose 1 honor. (Unlimited.)

pack_cards.flavor: "No price could be too high for victory."

records.name: Mark of Shame
records.text: Air role only. Reaction: After you play this attachment – dishonor attached character. Then, dishonor it again.

records.name: Massing at Twilight
records.text: Void role only. While resolving conflicts at this province, each character counts its combined [conflict-military] and [conflict-political] skill.

records.name: Master Alchemist
records.text: Action: During a conflict, spend 1 fate to the [element-fire] ring. Choose a character – honor or dishonor that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "The secrets of the elements are not kept by the kami alone."

records.name: Master Of Gisei Toshi
records.text: Reaction: After the conflict phase begins, choose a ring – while that ring is contested this phase, non-Spell events cannot be played.

pack_cards.flavor: There are strict rules regarding the behavior of guests. There have never been any guests.

records.name: Master of the Spear
records.text: Action: While this character is attacking, your opponent must choose a participating character he or she controls – move that character home.

records.name: Master of the Swift Waves
records.text: Action: During a conflict, choose a participating character you control and a character in your home – switch the chosen characters' location.

pack_cards.flavor: "When I call upon you, you will answer!"

records.name: Matsu Beiona
records.text: Reaction: After this character enters play, if you control 3 or more other Bushi characters – place 2 fate on this character.

pack_cards.flavor: When the rage surged forth, none could stand against them.

records.name: Matsu Mitsuko
records.text: Action: During a [conflict-military] conflict, if you are more honorable than your opponent, choose a character you control – move that character to the conflict.

records.name: Matsu Seventh Legion
records.text: No attachments except Weapon. While this character is attacking, each Courtier character cannot be declared as a defender.

records.name: Maze of Illusion
records.text: Action: During a conflict, choose a participating character controlled by an opponent – secretly select a number on your honor dial. Then, the chosen character's controller guesses whether this number is even or odd. Reveal your dial (cannot be modified). If they are wrong, bow and dishonor that character.

records.name: Meddling Mediator
records.text: Action: If an opponent has declared 2 or more conflicts against you this phase, select one – take 1 fate or 1 honor from that opponent.

records.name: Meditations on the Tao
records.text: Action: During a conflict at this province, choose an attacking character – remove 1 fate from that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "Appreciation of beauty is the beginning of wisdom." - Tao of Shinsei

records.name: Meek Informant
records.text: Reaction: After you play this character – look at an opponent's hand.

pack_cards.flavor:
Samurai seld notice peasants.
Peasants always notice samurai.

records.name: Meishōdō Wielder
records.text: Reduce the cost to play this character by 1 while you are the first player.

pack_cards.flavor: "I know the kami's Name. I can bend it to my will."

records.name: Menacing Iron Warrior
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a [conflict-military] conflict – until the end of the conflict, each participating character your opponent controls with equal or lower [conflict-military] skill than this character cannot trigger their abilities.

records.name: Minami Kaze Regulars
records.text: No attachments except Weapon. Reaction: After this character wins a conflict in which you have more participating characters than your opponent – gain 1 fate and draw 1 card.

records.name: Mirumoto Prodigy
records.text: While this character is attacking alone, your opponent cannot declare more than one defender.

pack_cards.flavor: Each new opponent showed her more of herself.

records.name: Mirumoto Raitsugu
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, choose a participating character controlled by your opponent – challenge that character to a [conflict-military] duel. If the loser of the duel has no fate on it, discard it. Otherwise remove 1 fate from it.

records.name: Mirumoto's Fury
records.text: Action: During a conflict, choose an attacking character with glory X or lower – bow that character. X is equal to the number of unrevealed provinces you control.

records.name: Misinformation
records.text: Action: During a conflict, if your honor bid is at least 2 higher than your opponent's – each participating character your opponent controls gets -1[conflict-military] and -1[conflict-political] until the end of the conflict.

records.name: Miwaku Kabe Guard
records.text: Pride. (After this character wins a conflict, honor it. After this character loses a conflict, dishonor it.)

pack_cards.flavor: "This wall is as unassailable as the honor of the Lion."

records.name: Miwaku Kabe
records.text: Limit 1 per deck. Interrupt: When this holding's province is broken – shuffle this card back into your dynasty deck.

records.name: Miya Mystic
records.text: Action: During the conflict phase, sacrifice this character. Choose an attachment – discard that attachment.

pack_cards.flavor: "Most of my family speak to the citizens of the Empire. I speak to the kami of the land itself."

records.name: Miya Satoshi
records.text: Action: Discard cards from your dynasty deck until you discard an Imperial card. Then, discard a card in a non-stronghold province you control and put the discarded Imperial card into that province, faceup.

pack_cards.flavor: "You who would speak to the Son of Heaven would do well to speak first to me."

records.name: Mono no Aware
records.text: Action: Remove 1 fate from each character. Draw 1 card. (Max 1 per round.)

pack_cards.flavor:
Autumn’s voice falters
Visions of days together
Fade with the new snow

records.name: Moto Horde
records.text: No attachments except Weapon.

pack_cards.flavor: Felled by swords or trampled by hooves: to face them was to face death.

records.name: Moto Juro
records.text: Action: Select one – move this character into a conflict or move this character home from a conflict. (Limit twice per round.)

pack_cards.flavor: "I will follow you, and they will follow me. Even into Jigoku itself."

records.name: Moto Nergüi
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a [conflict-military] conflict, choose a participating character with the highest glory in the conflict (you choose in case of a tie) – move that character home.

pack_cards.flavor: Honor is for those with no deeds to their name.

records.name: Moto Youth
records.text: This character gets +1[conflict-military] during the first [conflict-military] conflict each round.

pack_cards.flavor: Strike your enemies with such speed they cannot think to strike back.

records.name: Mountain's Anvil Castle
records.text: Action: During a conflict, bow this stronghold. Choose a participating character with 1 or more attachments on it – until the end of the conflict, that character gets +1[conflict-military] and +1[conflict-political] (+2[conflict-military] and +2[conflict-political] instead if it has 2 or more attachments on it).

records.name: Mountaintop Statuary
records.text: Reaction: After this holding is turned faceup – move it onto your stronghold province. Action: During a conflict at this province, sacrifice this holding. Choose an attacking character with printed cost 2 or lower – move that character home.

records.name: My Ancestor's Strength
records.text: Action: During a conflict, choose a participating Shugenja character you control and a character in your dynasty discard pile – until the end of the conflict, set the participating character's base [conflict-military] and [conflict-political] skill equal to the printed [conflict-military] and [conflict-political] skill of the other character.

records.name: Naive Student
records.text: Sincerity. (When this character leaves play, draw 1 card.)

pack_cards.flavor: "Your first lesson is to realize that facts alone cannot sway the soul." - Asako Hayate

records.name: Nezumi Infiltrator
records.text: Immune to Shadownlands and Mahō card effects. Reaction: After this character enters play during a conflict – until the end of the conflict, raise or lower the strength of the attacked province by 1 (to a minimum of 1). (Max 1 per conflict.)

records.name: Night Raid
records.text: Reaction: After this province is revealed – your opponent chooses and discards X cards from his or her hand. X is equal to the number of attacking characters.

records.name: Niten Adept
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, bow a (friendly) attachment on it. Choose a participating character without attachments – bow that character.

records.name: Niten Master
records.text: Reaction: After you attach a Weapon attachment to this character – ready this character. (Limit twice per round.)

records.name: Noble Sacrifice
records.text: Action: Sacrifice a (friendly) honored character. Choose a dishonored character – discard that character.

pack_cards.flavor: There was no greater honor.

records.name: Northern Wall Sensei
records.text: Keeper role only. Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, choose a participating character you control with 1 or more attachments – until the end of the conflict, that character is immune to events.

records.name: Obstinate Recruit
records.text: If an opponent is more honorable than you, discard this character.

pack_cards.flavor: Others might question his pride, assuming it would be his downfall. For him, it was a source of strength.

records.name: Ofushikai
records.text: Ancestral. Restricted. Attach to a unique [clan-phoenix] character you control. If attached character has the Champion trait, it gains "Action: During a conflict in which this character is participating, choose a participating character – move that character home. It cannot participate as an attacker this phase."

records.name: Oni Mask
records.text: Seeker role only. Attach to a character you control. Action: During a conflict, remove 1 fate from attached character. Choose a participating character – treat that character as if its printed text box were blank (except for Traits) until the end of the conflict.

records.name: Oracle of Stone
records.text: Action: Each player draws 2 cards. Then, each player discards 2 cards.

pack_cards.flavor: Pray it does not foretell disaster.

records.name: Origami Master
records.text: Pride. Action: Choose another character you control – move an honored status token from this character to the chosen character.

records.name: Ornate Fan
records.text: Restricted. (No more than two restricted attachments per character.)

pack_cards.flavor: At times, the ornamentation is the point. At others, it is merely a distraction.

records.name: Otomo Courtier
records.text: This character cannot participate in conflicts as an attacker against a player that controls the Imperial Favor.

pack_cards.flavor: "I speak with the voice of the Son of Heaven."

records.name: Outwit
records.text: Action: During a conflict, choose an opponent's character with lower [conflict-political] skill than a participating Courtier character you control – move the chosen character home.

records.name: Pacifism
records.text:
This attachment cannot be played during a conflict.
Attached character cannot participate in [conflict-military] conflicts.

pack_cards.flavor: A peaceful environment leads to a peaceful mind.

records.name: Pacifist Philosopher
records.text: Reaction: After a player passes on declaring a conflict - gain 1 fate. (Limit twice per round.)

pack_cards.flavor: Use your sword. You will only prove me correct.

records.name: Pathfinder's Blade
records.text: Seeker role only. Interrupt: When the effects of a triggered ability on the attacked province would initiate, if attached character is attacking, sacrifice this attachment – cancel those effects.

records.name: Perfect Land Ethos
records.text: Action: Discard each status token.

records.name: Pilgrimage
records.text: During conflicts at this province, cancel all ring effects. (If this province breaks, resolve ring effects as normal.)

records.name: Pillow Book
records.text: Action: While attached character is participating in a conflict – reveal the top card of your conflict deck until the end of the conflict. While it remains revealed, you may play that card as if it were in your hand.

records.name: Pit Trap
records.text: Attach to a character. Play only on an attacking character. Attached character does not ready during the regroup phase. Errata from RRG v1.2

pack_cards.flavor: "My apologies, samurai-san. That pit was intended for goblins." – Kaiu Shuichi

records.name: Policy Debate
records.text: Action: During a conflict, choose a participating character you control and a participating character your opponent controls – your character challenges the opponent's character to a [conflict-political] duel. The controller of the losing character reveals his or her hand. That player's opponent chooses and discards 1 card from it.

records.name: Political Rival
records.text: Covert. (When this character attacks, choose one character without covert. That character cannot be declared as a defender.) This character gets +3[conflict-political] while defending.

records.name: Pragmatism
records.text:
Attach to a character you control.
While you are less honorable than an opponent, attached character gets +1[conflict-military], +1[conflict-political], and gains: “This character cannot be honored or dishonored.”

records.name: Press of Battle
records.text: Water role only. Action: During a [conflict-military] conflict, if you control more participating characters than your opponent, choose a non-unique participating character – bow that character.

records.name: Prodigy of the Waves
records.text: Action: While the [element-water] ring is claimed – ready this character.

pack_cards.flavor: "To adapt and flow around any problem, this is the lesson of water." – Isawa’s Elements

records.name: Public Forum
records.text: Cannot be a stronghold province. Interrupt: When this province would be broken, if there are no honor tokens on it – place 1 honor token on it instead.

records.name: Radiant Orator
records.text: Action: While this character is participating in a conflict, if you count more current glory than your opponent among ready participating characters, choose an enemy character – move that character home.

records.name: Raging Battleground
records.text: Reaction: After this province is revealed, choose a non-unique character with no fate on it – discard that character.

records.name: Raise the Alarm
records.text: Action: During a [conflict-military] conflict in which you are the defending player – turn the dynasty card in the attacked province faceup. Then, if that card is a character, put it into play as a defender.

records.name: Rally to the Cause
records.text: Reaction: After this province is revealed – switch the conflict type. (The conflict retains its element.)

records.name: Reader of Omens
records.text: This character gets +3[conflict-political] while you have claimed the [element-air] or [element-void] ring.

pack_cards.flavor: "I have never seen birds this agressive before..."

records.name: Ready for Battle
records.text: Reaction: After an opponent's card effect or a ring effect bows a character you control – ready that character.

pack_cards.flavor: "We are prepared to pay any price."

records.name: Rebuild
records.text: Action: Shuffle a card in one of your unbroken provinces back into your dynasty deck. Choose a holding in your dynasty discard pile – put that holding into play in that province.

records.name: Reclusive Zokujin
records.text: During [element-earth] conflicts, this character gains covert and is immune to enemy card effects.

pack_cards.flavor: To see a Zokujin is a sign of great significance-the excitement of a myth sighed, and the dread of what drove it to the surface.

records.name: Reprieve
records.text: Interrupt: When attached character would leave play – discard this attachment instead.

pack_cards.flavor: There is one more thing that must be done.

records.name: Restoration of Balance
records.text: Reaction: After this province is revealed – your opponent chooses and discards cards from his or her hand until that player has 4 or fewer cards in hand.
